text: Scirpophaga parvalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Alfred Ernest Wileman in 1911. It is found in China (Heilongjiang, Beijing, Hebei, Shandong, Henan, Shaanxi, Gansu Jiangsu, Anhui, Hubei, Fujian), Japan and Korea. The wingspan is 20–25 mm for males and 25–31 mm for females.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) 42 (4) Both the forewings and hindwings are uniform white, but the females have a white anal tuft. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1911 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of China Category:Moths of Japan Category:Moths of Korea
title: Scirpophaga parvalis
